columns.Volume_ID: A unique identifier for each volume entry in the music database.
columns.Volume_Issue: Represents the specific issue or edition of the volume, often denoting a particular range or number.
columns.Issue_Date: The date or range of dates during which the volume issue was published.
columns.Weeks_on_Top: The number of weeks a particular song has remained at the top position in the music rankings.
columns.Song: The title of the song featured in the volume issue.
columns.Artist_ID: A reference to the unique identifier of the artist associated with the song listed in the volume.

volume.table_description: The volume table is designed to catalog music volume issues, detailing the performance of songs over time with relevant metadata about the songs and their respective artists.

columns.ID: Unique identifier for each music festival entry.
columns.Music_Festival: The name of the music festival being recorded.
columns.Date_of_ceremony: The date on which the awards ceremony took place.
columns.Category: The specific category of the award for which nominations are made.
columns.Volume: The identifier that links to a related volume of awards.
columns.Result: The outcome of the nomination, indicating whether the entry was awarded or merely nominated.

music_festival.table_description: The music_festival table records various entries related to music festival awards, capturing important details such as the festival name, ceremony date, award category, associated volume, and the results of nominations.

columns.Artist_ID: A unique identifier assigned to each artist.
columns.Age: The age of the artist at the time the data was recorded.
columns.Famous_Title: The title of the artist's most well-known work.
columns.Famous_Release_date: The release date of the artist's famous title.

artist.table_description: The artist table contains information about various music artists, including their unique identifiers, names, ages, notable works, and corresponding release dates.
